bio: Prince Yadav, a promising right-arm fast bowler from India, is steadily making his mark in the cricketing world. Born on 12 December 2001, Yadav has shown immense potential with the ball, particularly in domestic circuits. His journey began with a debut in the Ranji Trophy for Delhi against Jammu and Kashmir in January 2024, where he showcased his skills with a disciplined bowling performance. Although his first-class statistics are still in their infancy, with just two matches under his belt, Yadav has already demonstrated his ability to maintain a tight economy rate of 2.63, capturing one wicket in the process. In the Delhi Premier League T20, Yadav's performances have been noteworthy. Over ten matches, he has taken 13 wickets. His best bowling figures of 3-15 against Central Delhi Kings highlight his capability to deliver under pressure. Despite a few expensive outings, his overall economy rate of under 8 suggests a bowler who can adapt and learn quickly. Yadav's journey is still in its early stages, and while he has yet to make his mark on the international scene, his performances in domestic T20 leagues have caught the attention of selectors and fans alike. His ability to swing the ball and maintain a consistent line and length makes him a valuable asset for any team. As he continues to develop his skills, Yadav's potential to become a key player for India in the future is undeniable.
